item.title: Flytipping - you missed one!, 24th June
item.description:

item.title: Massive amount of flytipping outside 145 Eglinton Road, 24th June
item.description:
There is a lot of flytipping outside this property including sofas, cardboard and other rubbish. The pavement is blocked and people going to and from the school are having to go in the road. This address has been reported many times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Eglinton Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish dumped by tree outside 74 Marne St, 24th June
item.description:
Yet again, neighbouring properties dumping their household rubbish outside whenever they feel like it!! Foxes have attacked and now disgusting faeces stained wipes etc strewn around. This has to stop! Please send reminders to street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Marne Street, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree has become too large, 24th June
item.description:
The tree is at the bottom of Cromwell Road and is both brushing against our house and overhanging the roof. It was cut back a bit 5 years ago by the Council and requires attention again now. I would suggest a proper tree reduction uniformly around the tree so that it retains its good looks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road not swept, 24th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wetherell Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Street very dirty with lots of liter in its alloways through out the street. Can the litre in alloways be cleared, it makes the street so dirty and filthy., 24th June

item.title: Two Lime Bikes dumped in river Bec, 24th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Speeding signs and street lights need to be put up in Cocksure Lane and Bunkers Hill, 24th June
item.description:
Speeding signs and street lights need to be put up in Cocksure Lane and Bunkers Hill - resident said that cars are going 70/80 MPH down these roads as theres no signs to say what the limit should be and pedestrians (including children walking to school) are having to jump out the way of cars and they are speeding and it is dangerous when darker especially in the winter months as there are no street lights either - can this be looked into asap please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cocksure Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 56 Glengall Rd, 24th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
